issues.subject: Company Setup>Benefits>Rates Tab>Edit Rates for “Benefit Amount” benefits.
issues.description:
When editing the rates for a benefit that has a Benefit Amount tab, the rates table shows “Rated per” options: Rates As Per ____ of “Benefit Amount”/“Covered Salary”/“Neither”. 

1. This should read: “Rates +are+ per"
2. I would *like* not to see the "per 1000" option when "Neither" is selected, but I didn't see any great way to do this.

issues.subject: Combined Insurance HOP - Exporting Applications Plus issue with file name created during the export
issues.description:
HOP Link:  https://hop.commoncensus.com/Combined/
Company Name on HOP:  Seminole Gaming
Database Name:  NOVA:AVC
Registration Number:  1735

Issue:  Nora Berreles at Combined Insurance is trying to export apps on the HOP and received “Export Finished with Errors”.   I attempted an emulation and the export seem to work okay.  See the attached email with screen shots showing the error.  

There is another issue with the name of the export file created during the process.  Below are Combined Insurance specifications:

“First 2 letters of case name” + “Julian Date” + “Export file type (‘a’ for Applications & ‘b’ for Bank Drafts)” + “.” + “extension ‘pgp’” 
Example: “aa13058a.pgp” & “aa13058b.pgp”

PDS Rep: Jim

issues.subject: Company Setup>Benefits>Rates Tab>View / Appearance of rates table
issues.description:
The rates table should show more than 10 rows per page. This limit is hit very often (i.e.: 5yr age brackets from 24-75+ = 12 tiers). Add smoker status and that's 24 rate tiers on 3 pages!

When the table requires more than 1 page, the navigation is not 'noticeable'. We need to make the rate table 'page navigation' more like the benefits list page navigation.

issues.subject: Company Setup>Benefits>Provisions/Rates Tab>Rated provisions in benefits
issues.description:
First, rated provisions on benefits require you to select "Rated" when creating the provision, and then select the provision again in the "Rating Factors" section of the rates tab. This feels redundant, and we should make changes on the provisions tab "rated" checkbox impact the "Rating Factors" section, and vice-versa.

When renaming, deleting, or adding/removing values for a provision that is ‘rated’, you should receive a warning: “This provision is rated. Modifying or deleting this provision will clear the current rates. Are you sure you want to continue?" 

As inferred above, upon deleting a ‘rated’ provision, we should re-generate the rates table (if users continue after warning). 

When making a provision 'rated', you should receive a warning: “Making this provision rated will clear the current rates. Are you sure you want to continue?”. 

other issues remain with adding and removing or renaming list values:
1. Adding new values ideally does not clear the current rates, but adds the new option to the rates table
2. Removing values ideally does not clear the current rates, but removes the deleted option from the rates table
3. Editing a value (not yet possible with the tool) should not clear the current rates. Instead the name of the value in the rates table should be updated.
